page.title: 08Local history
page.content: After Mary's execution the judge at the trial,Justice Harding always visited her grave when he came to Presteigne and later he died in the town.The townspeople erected a {headstone}which reads: 'In memory of Mary Morgan who suffered April 13th 1805,aged 17.He that is without sin among you let him first cast a stone at her......' Fresh flowers are still placed near her head stone by.....well nobody actually knows by whom! Researched and written by Julie Clee,Beverley Tunley and Catherine Hatfield.
